Structs/RSAKey.html#/s:6Crypto6RSAKeyV6p.abstract: Creates a new RSAKey from a public key certificate file.

Structs/CryptoError.html.name: CryptoError
Structs/CryptoError.html.abstract: An error encountered while working with crypto.

Protocols/OpenSSLStreamCipher.html#/s:6C.name: reset(key:iv:mode:)
Protocols/OpenSSLStreamCipher.html#/s:6C.abstract: Resets / initializes the cipher algorithm context. Must be called before calling update.

Protocols/OpenSSLStreamCipher.html#/s:6C.name: update(data:into:)
Protocols/OpenSSLStreamCipher.html#/s:6C.abstract: Encrypts or decrypts a chunk of data into the supplied buffer.

Protocols/OpenSSLStreamCipher.html#/s:6C.name: finish(into:)
Protocols/OpenSSLStreamCipher.html#/s:6C.abstract: Finalizes the encryption or decryption, appending any additional data into the supplied buffer.

Protocols/OpenSSLStreamCipher.html#/s:6C.abstract: The OpenSSLCipherAlgorithm this stream cipher is interacting with

Protocols/OpenSSLCipherAlgorithm.html#/s.name: type
Protocols/OpenSSLCipherAlgorithm.html#/s.abstract: Returns the OpenSSL NID type for this algorithm.

Protocols/OpenSSLCipherAlgorithm.html#/s.name: blockSize
Protocols/OpenSSLCipherAlgorithm.html#/s.abstract: This cipher’s block size, used internally to allocate out buffers.

Protocols/OpenSSLCipherAlgorithm.html.abstract: OpenSSLCipherAlgorithm represents a common set of properties shared by

Protocols/OpenSSLStreamCipher.html.name: OpenSSLStreamCipher
Protocols/OpenSSLStreamCipher.html.abstract: OpenSSLStreamCipher is a protocol representing a higher-level interface for managing various OpenSSL stream ciphers.

Enums/RSAKeyType.html#/s:6Crypto10RSAKey.name: public
Enums/RSAKeyType.html#/s:6Crypto10RSAKey.abstract: A public RSA key. Used for verifying signatures.

Enums/RSAKeyType.html#/s:6Crypto10RSAKey.name: private
Enums/RSAKeyType.html#/s:6Crypto10RSAKey.abstract: A private RSA key. Used for creating and verifying signatures.

Enums/CipherMode.html#/s:6Crypto10Cipher.name: decrypt
Enums/CipherMode.html#/s:6Crypto10Cipher.abstract: Decrypts encrypted ciphertext back to its original value.

Global Variables.html#/s:6Crypto9AES256G.name: AES256GCM
Global Variables.html#/s:6Crypto9AES256G.abstract: AES-256 GCM Cipher. This is the reccomended cipher mode. (see https://github.com/vapor/crypto/issues/59).

Global Variables.html#/s:6Crypto9AES256C.name: AES256CBC
Global Variables.html#/s:6Crypto9AES256C.abstract: AES-256 CBC Cipher. Only use this if you know what you are doing; use AES-256 GCM otherwise (see https://github.com/vapor/crypto/issues/59).

Classes/RSA.html#/s:6Crypto3RSAC9algorit.name: algorithm
Classes/RSA.html#/s:6Crypto3RSAC9algorit.abstract: The hashing algorithm to use, (e.g., SHA512). See DigestAlgorithm.

Classes/RSA.html#/s:6Crypto3RSACAcA15Dig.abstract: Creates a new RSA cipher using the supplied DigestAlgorithm.

Classes/RSA.html#/s:6Crypto3RSAC4sign10F.abstract: Signs the supplied input (in format specified by format).

Classes/HMAC.html#/s:6Crypto4HMACC12auth.abstract: Authenticates the message using the supplied key. This method will first initialize or reset the HMAC

Classes/HMAC.html#/s:6Crypto4HMACC5reset.name: reset(key:)
Classes/HMAC.html#/s:6Crypto4HMACC5reset.abstract: Initializes or resets the HMAC context. This method sets this HMAC’s key for subsequent calls to update(data:).

Classes/HMAC.html#/s:6Crypto4HMACC6updat.abstract: Updates the HMAC digest with a new chunk of data. This method can be called repeatedly for each new chunk.

Classes/HMAC.html#/s:6Crypto4HMACC6finis.name: finish()
Classes/HMAC.html#/s:6Crypto4HMACC6finis.abstract: Completes the HMAC digest. This method should be called once after one call to reset(key:) and one more

Classes/DigestAlgorithm.html#/s:6Crypto1.name: named(_:)
Classes/DigestAlgorithm.html#/s:6Crypto1.abstract: Looks up a hash function algorithm by name (e.g., sha256).

Classes/DigestAlgorithm.html#/s:6Crypto1.abstract: Returns the OpenSSL NID type for this algorithm.

Classes/Digest.html#/s:6Crypto6DigestC4h.name: hash(_:)
Classes/Digest.html#/s:6Crypto6DigestC4h.abstract: Creates a digest for the supplied data. This method will call .reset(), .update(data:), and .finish().

Classes/Digest.html#/s:6Crypto6DigestC5r.name: reset()
Classes/Digest.html#/s:6Crypto6DigestC5r.abstract: Resets / initializes the digest algorithm context. This must be called once before calling update(data:).

Classes/Digest.html#/s:6Crypto6DigestC6u.name: update(data:)
Classes/Digest.html#/s:6Crypto6DigestC6u.abstract: Updates the digest with another data chunk. This can be called multiple times. Use this method for streaming digests.

Classes/Digest.html#/s:6Crypto6DigestC6f.name: finish()
Classes/Digest.html#/s:6Crypto6DigestC6f.abstract: Finalizes the digest, returning the digest data.

Classes/CipherAlgorithm.html#/s:6Crypto1.name: named(_:)
Classes/CipherAlgorithm.html#/s:6Crypto1.abstract: Looks up a cipher function algorithm by name (e.g., aes-128-cbc).

Classes/CipherAlgorithm.html#/s:6Crypto1.name: aes256cfb
Classes/CipherAlgorithm.html#/s:6Crypto1.abstract: AES-256 CFB cipher. May not be available on all platforms.

Classes/CipherAlgorithm.html#/s:6Crypto1.abstract: Returns the OpenSSL NID type for this algorithm.

Classes/CipherAlgorithm.html#/s:6Crypto1.name: blockSize
Classes/CipherAlgorithm.html#/s:6Crypto1.abstract: This cipher’s block size, used internally to allocate out buffers.

Classes/Cipher.html#/s:6Crypto6CipherC7d.abstract: Decrypts the supplied ciphertext back to plaintext. This method will call reset(key:iv:mode:), update(data:into:),

Classes/AuthenticatedCipherAlgorithm.htm.name: named(_:)
Classes/AuthenticatedCipherAlgorithm.htm.abstract: Looks up an authenticated cipher function algorithm by name (e.g., aes-256-gcm).

Classes/AuthenticatedCipherAlgorithm.htm.name: aes256gcm
Classes/AuthenticatedCipherAlgorithm.htm.abstract: AES-256 GCM cipher. This is the recommended cipher.

Classes/AuthenticatedCipher.html#/s:6Cry.abstract: Encrypts the supplied plaintext into ciphertext. This method will call reset(key:iv:mode:), update(data:into:),

Classes/AuthenticatedCipher.html#/s:6Cry.abstract: Decrypts the supplied ciphertext back to plaintext. This method will call reset(key:iv:mode:), update(data:into:),

Classes/AuthenticatedCipher.html#/s:6Cry.abstract: Gets the Tag from the CIPHER_CTX struct.

Classes/AuthenticatedCipher.html#/s:6Cry.name: setTag(_:)
Classes/AuthenticatedCipher.html#/s:6Cry.abstract: Sets the Tag in the CIPHER_CTX struct.

Classes/BCryptDigest.html#/s:6Crypto12BC.abstract: Creates a new BCryptDigest. Use the global BCrypt convenience variable.

Classes/BCryptDigest.html#/s:6Crypto12BC.abstract: Creates a BCrypt digest for the supplied data.

Classes/BCryptDigest.html#/s:6Crypto12BC.name: verify(_:created:)
Classes/BCryptDigest.html#/s:6Crypto12BC.abstract: Verifies an existing BCrypt hash matches the supplied plaintext value. Verification works by parsing the salt and version from

Classes/BCryptDigest.html.name: BCryptDigest
Classes/BCryptDigest.html.abstract: Creates and verifies BCrypt hashes. Normally you will not need to initialize one of these classes and you will

Classes/AuthenticatedCipher.html.name: AuthenticatedCipher
Classes/AuthenticatedCipher.html.abstract: AuthenticatedCipher supports AEAD-type ciphers. It feels a lot like ‘Cipher’ except that it supports the

Classes/AuthenticatedCipherAlgorithm.htm.name: AuthenticatedCipherAlgorithm
Classes/AuthenticatedCipherAlgorithm.htm.abstract: Specifies an authenticated cipher algorithm (e.g., AES-256-GCM) to be used with an AuthenticatedCipher.

Classes/Cipher.html.name: Cipher
Classes/Cipher.html.abstract: Cryptographic encryption and decryption functions for converting plaintext to and from ciphertext.

Classes/CipherAlgorithm.html.name: CipherAlgorithm
Classes/CipherAlgorithm.html.abstract: Specifies a cipher algorithm (e.g., AES128-ECB) to be used with a Cipher.

Classes/Digest.html.name: Digest
Classes/Digest.html.abstract: Cryptographic hash functions convert data of arbitrary size to a fixed-size digest.

Classes/HMAC.html.name: HMAC
Classes/HMAC.html.abstract: HMAC is a MAC (message authentication code), i.e. a keyed hash function used for message authentication, which is based on a hash function.

Classes/RSA.html.name: RSA
Classes/RSA.html.abstract: RSA is an asymmetric cryptographic algorithm for signing and verifying data.

Global Variables.html.abstract: The following global variables are available globally.
